intro.title: Hello!
intro.body: My name is Parth Dhyani and I am a full stack developer. I am currently a software engineer at HubSpot, where I work on a frontend engineering team that builds tools for external developers to build integrations with HubSpot’s platform. I recently graduated from The University of Michigan, where I led The Michigan Daily newspaper's 35-person software development team. In my free time, I enjoy reading books and tending to my houseplants and aquariums. For more, please check out my experience below and feel free to reach out!

entries.name: The University of Michigan⁠ — Ann Arbor
entries.description: B.S.E. in Computer Science, 2022 Minor in German Studies, 2022 Magna Cum Laude

entries.name: The Illinois Mathematics and Science Academy (IMSA)

types.name: Languages
types.skills: JavaScript; C++; C; Python; R; HTML; CSS; Sass; SQLite

types.name: Frameworks/Libraries
types.skills: React; React Native; Vue; Gatsby; D3; Flask; Django; Jasmine; Jest

types.name: Cloud
types.skills: AWS (S3, Lambda, EC2, CloudFront, Route59); GCP (Firestore, App Engine)

roles.name: Software Engineer
roles.description: I am a frontend software engineer in the Developer Product Group.

roles.name: Software Engineering Co-op
roles.description: As a software engineering intern on the Strategic Integrations Frontend Team, I used React to build settings pages for integrations to HubSpot to allow users to sync and manage their data in one place. For example, I helped build tables that allow customers to create, edit, and validate data mappings between HubSpot and external apps (like Shopify and QuickBooks integrations).

roles.name: Managing Online Editor (Lead Engineer)
roles.description: I led the newspaper’s 35-person software team, which includes data engineers, web developers, mobile engineers, and product designers. I helped launch a new michigandaily.com website to better serve our 350k monthly users, in addition to leading development on various  other  sites  and  projects created with React and deployed via AWS.

roles.name: Project Manager
roles.description: I managed and mentored an 8-person data visualization team, where we used D3.js and web scraping to create interactive data-driven articles, like this award-winning series on UMich college admissions.

roles.name: Data Visualization Engineer
roles.description: I learned how to web scrape, query APIs, and create data visualizations using D3.js for news articles.

roles.name: Software Engineering Intern
roles.description: With 3 other interns, I developed a data-sharing web app, where Humana employees can request and track access for Google BigQuery datasets. We developed the frontend for the app in Vue.js, the backend REST API with Flask, and used a NoSQL Google Firestore database. Our project was built and released through Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines and deployed to Google Cloud App Engine.

roles.name: Docent
roles.description: I gave public tours of the museum and science demonstrations, helped run STEM outreach events, and scheduled field trips.

roles.name: Forest Ecology Student Researcher
roles.description: At The Center for Tree Science, I researched the phenology (timing of life cycle events) of native and invasive plant species in a forest environment. This involved weekly data collection in the field and analyzing the data through R.
